result.execSummary:
The defendant Eduardo Cervantes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI Cause Injury (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay all of the following by the end of probation/supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: Fine in the amount of $500.00; Court ordered defendant to pay a $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge; All court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA; All applicable fees of supervision. If revoked, the court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
- Restitution in the amount of $0 (zero).
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Huber for work with 65 hours maximum per week. Report date 08-05-2016 by 5pm. Court is opposed to electronic monitoring until 150 days served.
Successfully complete (40) hours of community service

Count one.  

(return address: Eduardo Cervantes #645792, Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, P.O. Box 05911, Milwaukee, WI   53205-0911)

Motion to Grant Good Time Credit for Jail Time imposed as a condition of probation
The defendant's motion or request for child care release privileges is DENIED; Received, filed and signed by the Court on September 16, 2016. Copies distributed to parties.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, for review. mag
Motion to Modify Huber Release Privileges to Include Relase for Child Care
Associated with Charge #1
-Received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
-Received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS with 7 (seven) days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 24 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.  

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 36 MONTHS probation.

 Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 225 days condition time/ Huber for work with 65 hours maximum per week. Report date: August 5, 2016 by 5:00 p.m.
- Court is opposed to electronic monitoring until 150 days served.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Successfully complete (40) hours of community service. 
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of probation/supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $500.00; 
Court ordered defendant to pay a $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge.  
Court ordered Driver's Safety Plan. Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of 24 months. Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 24 months to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.  
Restitution in the amount of $0 (zero); 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.  
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Driver Assessment And Driver Safety Plan
Sentencing Referral Form;

Defendant Eduardo Cervantes in court with attorney Michael a Verrilli.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

AS TO COUNT 2:

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
